column4: Hello can i just reinstall ubuntu easy? i dont want to create another partition or something, just use the same that  its on now
just follow the install
it will install over the top of your existing data
yes but the installer says "install side by side" i dont want that
chose manual partition and select the same partitions
is it that easy? choose (advanced)
very common sense stuff
what part is not clear ?
well i can change partition and stuff tp "journal ext3 " and ext2 and so son, what should i do?
should i choose my current ubuntu partition as ext3 journal ?
yes
it's common sense stuff -
well if i dont know all this ext3 and what it means? If you dont contribute then please dont say anything, Dont be a wiseguy
I wasn't being a wise guy
I was trying to explain that if you follow it through with common sense you won't go far wrong - eg: do you want to format this (yes - you want to wipe the disk)
so drop the attitude please.
I was jusk asking for help what it means, and if its neccessary to format, and if i dont. What happens?
if you don't - it won't wipe the disk, which isn't a good call for a clean install
as I said, common sense stuff, if you want a clean install and wipe the disk = good, if you want a clean install and install over the top of the existing install = confusion
its common sense for those who know
if you follow the inststurctions on screen it should guide you and explain most of the options at a high level
thanks for  the help
#ubuntu+1 is the correct channel for 9.10 discussion
